qas.question: What date did Namibia get it's official name?
What was the resolution that granted Namibia it's name?
How long did it take for South Africa to agree to the implantation of Namibia's new name?
The diplomatic agreement between South Africa, Angola, and Cuba was observed by the USSR and what other country?
On what date  in 1978 did the UN Security Council pass Resolution 2372?
In what year had Cuba sent troops to Angola?
In what year had the MPLA formed?
Since what year had UNITA controlled Angola?
Among which countries had been trying to persuade South Africa to give Namibia independence?

context: <a0_0>South West Africa<a0_0/> became known as Namibia by the UN when the General Assembly changed the territory's name by <a2_0>Resolution 2372 (XXII)<a2_0/> of <a1_0><b5_0>12 June<b5_0/> <b7_0><b8_0>1968<b8_0/><b7_0/><a1_0/>. In <b6_0>1978<b6_0/> the UN Security Council passed UN Resolution 435 which planned a transition toward independence for Namibia. Attempts to persuade South Africa to agree to the plan's implementation were not successful until <a3_0>1988<a3_0/> when the transition to independence finally started under a diplomatic agreement between South Africa, <b9_0>Angola<b9_0/> and Cuba, with the USSR and the <a4_0>USA<a4_0/> as observers, under which South Africa agreed to withdraw and demobilise its forces in Namibia. As a result, Cuba agreed to pull back its troops in southern Angola sent to support the MPLA in its war for control of Angola with UNITA.
